item.title: Matrix Methods in Machine Learning
item.description: Unit 2 Linear Independence and Rank in Learning Linear independence A set of $M$ vectors $v_1, v_2, \cdots, v_m \in \mathbb{R}^N$ is linear independent if and only if \[\sum^M_{i=1} v_i\alpha_i = 0 \Leftrightarrow \alpha_i = 0, i = 1, 2, \cdots M.\] Otherwise, it's called linearly dependent. A matrix multiplication of $Aw = d$ can be interpreted as the linear combination of the columns of $A$, where the weight for the $i^\text{th}$ column is the $i^\text{th}$ element of $w$.
